examples.sentence: The cat nabbed the mouse just as it tried to steal the cheese.
I finally nabbed the last limited edition sneakers in the store.
The police nabbed the pickpocket in the middle of the act.
Undercover agents nabbed the drug dealers at the train station.
He nabbed the front seat before I could react.
The seagull nabbed my hot dog right out of my hand!
The NAB conference attracts media professionals worldwide.
NAB regulations affect broadcasting standards in 85 countries.
She nabbed a bargain during the Double Eleven shopping festival.

examples.sentence: The ancient sailors used the nadir to calibrate their astrolabes.
When the moon is at its nadir, it's directly opposite the zenith.
After losing his job and failing the exam, he reached the nadir of his life.
The stock price hit its nadir during the financial crisis.
The farmer's nag could barely pull the cart uphill.
He bet all his money on a nag and lost.
My mom turns into a nag when I forget to drink hot water.
The boss is such a nag about the TPS reports.
She keeps nagging me to wear long johns in winter.
My conscience nags me like an old wife.
The unanswered question nagged at his mind all day.
Her migraine has been nagging for three days.
The smell of durian kept nagging at his nostrils.
She finally nagged him into getting a haircut.

examples.sentence: The nagging sound of my mom asking 'have you worn long johns?' haunted me throughout winter.
His nagging reminders about sunscreen made me finally buy an umbrella hat.
The nagging comments from Weibo trolls are like mosquitos in summer.
She gave him a nagging look when he added cilantro to the hotpot.
I had a nagging feeling that I forgot to turn off the rice cooker.
"Want some durian?" "Nah, that smells like gym socks."
Nah means no but with extra laziness.
There's nah difference between these two bubble tea flavors.
He has nah chance winning against a grandmaster.
The carpenter spat out three rusty nails while singing Beijing opera.
These bamboo nails are used in traditional Chinese architecture.
Her nails were painted with Terracotta Warriors patterns.
Chinese guzheng players wear special nails for plucking strings.
We nailed the Spring Festival couplets with lucky red ribbons.
He nailed the mahjong table legs so they wouldn't wobble.
The DJ nailed our attention with a remix of Jasmine Flower.
The goalkeeper nailed the penalty kick with panda-like agility.
The journalist nailed the scam using hidden camera footage.
Let's nail down the hotpot ingredients before 6pm.

usages.form: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: Your analysis of douyin trends really hit the nail on the head.
The wooden crate was nailed shut with rusty hinges.
His DIY bookshelf looked precarious because none of the boards were properly nailed.
When she perfectly replicated the viral dance, comments flooded in saying 'nailed it!'
Her naive belief that all subway singers are professionals was adorable.
The tourist's naive question about pandas speaking Sichuan dialect went viral.
Children's naive drawings of dumplings with smiley faces warm people's hearts.
The old couple still keep naive love letters from their college years.
His naive plan to get rich by collecting bottle caps shocked everyone.
Thinking you can master Peking Opera in three days is naive.
The child naively believed the moon was made of cheese.
She naively shared her ice cream with a seagull, then cried when it stole the whole cone.
Tourists naively tried to pet the wild pandas before being stopped by rangers.
He naively thought all online shopping discounts were genuine until the 11.11 festival.

examples.sentence: The children's naivete shines through their drawings of rainbow-colored pandas.
Her naivete made her believe all ice cream trucks play music for free treats.
The puppy's naivete was evident when it tried to befriend a vacuum cleaner.
His naivete led him to trust every 'limited-time offer' pop-up ad.
The old professor cherished the naivete of freshmen before they discovered Wikipedia.
There's a special naivete in believing 5G towers cause COVID-19.
The billionaire's childlike naivete about subway fares went viral.
She lost her naivete after realizing Santa's handwriting matched her dad's.
Her naivety shines through when she believes every WeChat rumor.
The child's naivety in thinking all cats can speak Mandarin amused everyone.
His naivety of giving passwords to strangers caused a financial disaster.
The old man's naivety in online dating scams broke his family's heart.
The emperor walked through the street with his naked confidence.
Babies enjoy the feeling of being naked during summer.
She prefers the naked beauty of undecorated ceramic.
The naked truth often hurts more than sugarcoated lies.
Never look at solar eclipse with naked eyes.
The naked wire caused an electric shock accident.
After the war, they were left naked of all possessions.
The naked poverty in the village shocked the volunteers.
Some microorganisms are invisible to the naked eye.
Keep alcohol away from naked flames.
The statue stands nakedly in the town square, shocking Victorian visitors.
Babies swim nakedly in some European saunas.
The wiring hangs nakedly from the ceiling like spaghetti.
His ambition was nakedly obvious during the promotion race.

examples.sentence: The emperor's nakedness was exposed by a child's honest remark.
Some tribes view nakedness as a connection to nature.
The nakedness of his lies shocked everyone.
The report revealed the nakedness of the economic crisis.
The statue captures the hero in his nakedness of spirit.
His English name 'Bruce' was chosen after Bruce Lee.
The panda cub's name was decided by 10 million netizens.
The restaurant made a name for its explosive crayfish.
She's risking her name by endorsing this product.
They named their daughter 'Doudou' after her chubby cheeks.
The typhoon was named 'Haikui' meaning sea anemone.
Three Chinese films were named for the Oscar shortlist.
The professor was named chairperson of the committee.
Please fill in your name tag before the meeting.
The name list of lottery winners was posted online.
In the name of mooncakes, I'll punish you! (parodying anime lines)
Netizens were calling each other names during the livestream.

examples.sentence: The named suspect in the case turned out to be a food delivery guy.
The police asked for the named individual to come forward.
Please submit the report to the named department by Friday.
The named meeting room was already occupied by a surprise birthday party.
The named hotpot chain opened its 1000th store in Chengdu.
The museum exhibits works by named contemporary artists.
The nameless hero saved the village during the flood.
A nameless poet left these verses carved on the temple wall.
She received a bouquet from a nameless admirer.
The whistleblower chose to remain nameless for safety reasons.
There was a nameless terror in the abandoned hospital.
He felt a nameless sadness when the moon rose.
We need two toppings, namely cheese and spicy crayfish.
The app supports 3 languages, namely Chinese, English and Sichuan dialect.
The ultimate comfort food - namely, hot pot - cures all sadness.
He's a zhaji foodie, namely someone who photos every dish for 5 minutes.
The doctor's nameplate shone like a mini sun on the office door.
Her rose-gold nameplate necklace became a TikTok trend.
The antique nameplate on the teahouse was carved by a Qing Dynasty craftsman.
The glowing Tesla nameplate automatically lights up at night.
Every CEO in the 1980s wanted a brass nameplate thicker than a dictionary.
The mahogany door nameplate fell during the typhoon and hit a delivery robot.

examples.sentence: The basketball star met his 8-year-old namesake at a fan event.
My namesake in Australia turns out to be a famous koala researcher!
The restaurant is the namesake of its founder's favorite novel.
Tianwen-1 Mars probe shares its namesake with an ancient Chinese poem.
Namibians celebrate Independence Day on March 21st with traditional dances.
A Namibian taught me how to survive in the desert by collecting fog.
The Namibian dollar features desert wildlife like oryx antelopes.
Namibian sand dunes are famous among photographers for their red color.
Namibian hospitality often includes serving homemade biltong.
The Namibian football team is nicknamed 'Brave Warriors'.
The Namibian Desert's 'fairy circles' puzzle scientists worldwide.
Namibian-Germans still bake Black Forest cake in Windhoek.
The naming of panda cubs always attracts millions of online voters.
Chinese parents consider naming their children as the first gift in life.

examples.sentence: The toddler shouted 'Nan! Look at my drawing!' while holding a crayon masterpiece.
My nan always sneaks me extra candy when mom isn't looking.
The curry tastes best when scooped with freshly baked nan.
This restaurant's garlic nan is so fluffy it's like eating clouds.
The nan bread puffed up like a balloon in the tandoor oven.
The scoop about alien pandas was first published by NANA in 1932.
NANA pioneered the use of carrier pigeons for breaking news delivery.
The NANA correspondent wore a press hat with a built-in telegraph machine.
The tech couple hired a nanny who could code Python for their toddler.
Modern nannies often need to operate smart home devices.
The nanny goat butted the drone away from her kids.
Nanny goats produce milk for famous goat cheese.
Banning oversized soda cups was criticized as nanny state policy.
The viral video of a nanny dancing with baby came from a nanny cam.
A hummingbird's wings complete a full flap in just 30 nanoseconds.
Light travels about 30 centimeters in one nanosecond.
Douyin videos can go viral in nanoseconds.
Her mood shifts happen in nanoseconds when she sees durian.
A 20-minute power nap can reboot your brain like restarting a smartphone.
The CEO takes cat naps in his Tesla during lunch breaks.
This premium wool blanket has uniform naps that feel like panda fur.
The velvet's nap changes color when brushed in different directions.
Investing in that startup was his final nap before retirement.
Pandas nap 10 hours daily to conserve bamboo energy.
The goalkeeper napped for just a second before the ball flew in.
The factory naps the fabric to create that fluffy texture.
The gambler napped the underdog at 50:1 odds.
The rival company caught us napping with their new product launch.
He went nap on Bitcoin before the bull market.

examples.sentence: The museum displayed a deactivated napalm bomb from the Vietnam War.
Napalm sticks to surfaces like superglue mixed with fire.
The documentary showed forests being napalmed during wartime.
Villagers still remember the day their rice fields were napalmed.
The kitten's nape smells like sunshine and milk.
He felt a cold raindrop slide down his nape.
The ancient Persians used naphtha in their legendary fire weapons.
Naphtha is a key raw material for producing plastics in modern industry.
Artists in Renaissance Europe sometimes used naphtha as paint thinner.
The distinct odor of naphtha reminds people of gasoline stations.
Light naphtha is mainly used to produce petrochemical products.
The Michelin restaurant folds napkins into swan shapes.
He wiped his mouth with a linen napkin after eating Peking duck.
Hotpot restaurants provide unlimited paper napkins.
She doodled on the Starbucks napkin while waiting.
Modern napkins have wetness indicators for babies.
The disposable napkins are as thin as banknotes but super absorbent.
Vending machines for sanitary napkins are now common in women's restrooms.
The Napoleonic Code still influences modern legal systems.
His hat was in the Napoleonic style with a distinctive cockade.
The CEO has a Napoleonic approach to corporate management.
She made a Napoleonic decision to conquer the new market.
This Napoleonic era painting sold for 2 million euros.
The museum displayed Napoleonic uniforms from the 1805 campaign.
The Napoleonic family tree includes several European monarchs.
Josephine's letters revealed Napoleonic family dynamics.
The panda-shaped nappy went viral on Xiaohongshu.
British parents call diapers 'nappies' like Americans say 'soccer' for football.
She served mapo tofu in a blue-edged nappy.
Antique nappies are collector's items in Jiangxi kilns.
The nappy texture of this sweater traps heat like a steamed bun.
This nappy cocktail will knock you out faster than baijiu.
Her nappy hair defies gravity like dandelion fluff.
His constant selfies reveal a disturbing level of narcissism.
The influencer's narcissism peaked when she gifted herself 100 roses on livestream.
Narcissism makes him spend 3 hours choosing filters for WeChat moments.
Her narcissism is so severe she named her cat 'Mini-Me'.
From checking mirrors to plastic surgery, narcissism spectrum covers it all.
His narcissistic speech lasted 3 hours without noticing the audience sleeping.
The narcissistic CEO installed golden mirrors in every elevator.
She takes 200 selfies daily - that's textbook narcissistic behavior.
His narcissistic personality makes him believe he's the reincarnation of Leonardo da Vinci.
Diagnosing narcissistic personality disorder requires professional evaluation.
The narcissus blooming in my grandma's porcelain pot smells like spring.
In Greek myths, narcissus flowers grew where the handsome youth died.
We force narcissus bulbs to bloom by Lunar New Year with warm water.
Ancient surgeons used poppy-based narcotics during bone-setting procedures.
The smuggler hid narcotics in durian shipments.
Some fish keepers use narcotics to calm sharks during transport.
The vet injected a mild narcotic to examine the aggressive corgi.
The narcotic effect of this herb made it popular in ancient acupuncture.
Bubble tea pearls have a strangely narcotic chewiness.
The narcotic rhythm of rain on the roof put the baby to sleep.
Her narcotic voice could calm the angriest livestream troll.
The narcotic effect of Sichuan peppercorns numbs your tongue delightfully.
Some TikTok trends spread faster than narcotic addiction.
The grandpa narrates Journey to the West with exploding gestures.
Audiobooks narrated by AI lack the warmth of human storytellers.
The museum app narrates cultural relics with 3D animations.
She narrated the vaccine process with emoji illustrations.
The documentary narrates pandemic stories from Wuhan to New York.
Ancient murals narrate harvest scenes with dancing figures.
He narrated in detail how zongzi evolved from sacrifice to snack.
The novel first-person narrates a time-traveling chef's adventure.
The documentary uses Morgan Freeman's velvet narration to explain black holes.
Her vivid narration of the Tibetan pilgrimage made us feel like being there.
The AI-generated narration about a dumpling's adventure went viral.
Traditional Peking opera combines singing with martial arts narration.
The gaokao English test often requires writing a narration about campus life.
His WeChat post was a humorous narration of cooking disaster.
The novel uses first-person narration to create intimacy with readers.
The museum app provides voice narration in 12 dialects.
The grandma's narrative about Moon Palace made us cry.
TikTok challenges the traditional narrative of news reporting.
The narrative of Journey to the West inspired countless games.
Chinese web novels are famous for their fast-paced narratives.
The documentary uses narrative poetry as its opening.
Her narrative skills make even grocery shopping sound epic.
The Belt and Road Initiative is a new grand narrative of globalization.
The novel uses first-person narrative to describe the Forbidden City.
The audiobook narrator made dinosaurs sound like Peking opera singers.
As the narrator of our company history, Uncle Wang always adds spicy hotpot anecdotes.
The documentary's narrator explained terra cotta warriors with rap rhythm.
A good travel vlog narrator makes even traffic jams sound adventurous.
That food blogger is an unreliable narrator - her 'tiny snack' is actually a whole roast duck.
The boat got stuck in the narrows of the Yangtze River.
Tourists love taking photos at the narrows of Zhangjiajie's stone forest.
Ancient traders had to pass through dangerous narrows in the Silk Road.
Chongqing's hutongs are so narrow that two umbrellas can't open simultaneously.
The pharmacist gave the prescription a narrow examination.
We have only a narrow window of time to catch the last metro.
The team won by a narrow margin of 0.5 points.
Breaking away from narrow nationalism requires global vision.
The narrow boss wouldn't even pay for team-building hotpot.
The river narrows dramatically before the Three Gorges.
The construction narrowed the bicycle lane by half.
Police narrowed down suspects using Douyin videos.
The panda had a narrow escape from falling into the tourist area.
The narrowed alley could barely fit two bicycles side by side.
After the renovation, the narrowed doorway became a safety hazard.
The river narrowed to a stream after the drought.
She narrowed her eyes at the suspicious WeChat message.
We've narrowed down the suspects to three delivery guys.
The narrowing of the river created dangerous currents.
Doctors observed the narrowing of his airways during the examination.
Police are narrowing down the list of suspects.
She's narrowing down her college choices to three options.
The alley was so narrow that pedestrians could only pass through narrowly.
She narrowly arranged her collection of 100 lipsticks on the tiny shelf.
The customs officer narrowly examined every jar of Lao Gan Ma chili sauce.
TikTok's algorithm narrowly monitors content that violates community guidelines.
Grandma narrowly selected the freshest cabbage in the wet market.
He narrowly checked every bubble tea order against the receipt.
The delivery guy narrowly escaped being scolded when the bubble tea arrived 1 minute before deadline.
We narrowly avoided missing the high-speed rail because of a shared bike.
After eating 20 dumplings, I could narrowly zip up my jeans.
The elevator narrowly held 12 delivery workers with their takeout boxes.
The influencer's apology video narrowly got 10,000 'dislikes' in 5 minutes.
His salary increase was narrowly enough to buy 3 extra milk teas per month.
'Zongzi' is narrowly defined as pyramid-shaped rice dumplings.
The cat narrowly escaped being bathed by hiding in the delivery box.
The narrowness of Tokyo apartments shocks first-time visitors.
Engineers overcame the narrowness of the space by building vertically.
His narrowness in splitting the bill exactly by cent shocked everyone.
The narrowness of her worldview comes from never traveling abroad.
The poet criticized the spiritual narrowness of his era.

examples.sentence: Pilgrims would gather in the narthex before entering the sacred space.
The narthex mosaic depicts fishermen casting nets, symbolizing spiritual preparation.
Modern church narthexes often have donation boxes and bulletin boards.
Wedding guests chatted in the narthex while waiting for the bride.
The doctor examined his nasal cavity with a tiny flashlight.
Pandas have special nasal bones to protect them while eating bamboo.
Her nasal voice sounds like she's always holding her nose.
The cartoon character speaks in an exaggerated nasal tone.
The nasal sound of the suona startled the sleeping baby.
The French nasal 'on' makes English speakers want to pinch their noses.
'M' and 'n' are nasals that make your nose vibrate when humming.
Spicy hotpot can temporarily relieve nasal congestion.
The nascent metaverse industry is attracting crazy investments.
We observed nascent democracy in the ancient text.
His nascent singing career began with douyin live streams.
The nascent AI displayed baby-level intelligence.
Blockchain was in its nascent stage when Bitcoin first appeared.
The patient required a nasogastric tube for liquid nutrition.
Doctors inserted a nasogastric tube like feeding a dinosaur through its nostril.
The rookie nurse practiced nasogastric intubation on a training mannequin.
The abandoned fridge smelled nastily of rotten eggs.
He wiped his hands nastily on the velvet curtains.
She laughed nastily when I tripped over the cable.
The soup was nastily sweet with artificial flavoring.
The influencer behaved nastily to restaurant staff on live stream.

examples.sentence: The nastiness of the public toilet made people hold their breath.
He gagged at the nastiness inside the garbage chute.
The nastiness of street food stalls often worries tourists.
Her OCD couldn't tolerate the slightest nastiness on cutlery.
The nastiness of his jokes ruined the party atmosphere.
Nobody expected such nastiness from a children's cartoon.
The nasturtiums climbed up my grandma's fence like tiny umbrellas.
Bees love the bright orange nasturtium in my urban balcony garden.
She garnished the salad with edible nasturtium flowers.
The peppery taste of nasturtium made the dish uniquely flavorful.
This Michelin restaurant serves nasturtium salad with gold flakes.
The nasty stains on his shirt told the story of yesterday's hot pot party.
Avoid that nasty alley - it smells like rotten stinky tofu.
He got fired for making nasty jokes during the Zoom meeting.
The drama was criticized for its nasty dialogues.
That's a nasty trick to cheat elderly people out of their pensions.
Be careful of the nasty curve on this mountain road.
The nasty weather canceled all flights at Pudong Airport.
His nasty habit of spitting in public disgusts everyone.
The panda's natal day is celebrated with bamboo cakes.
Her natal village still keeps the traditional birth rituals.
The natal moment of TikTok changed social media forever.
Scientists observed the natal process of a new star.
Her natal chart predicted she would love spicy food.
The Panda Diplomacy helped this nation build friendships worldwide.
Hotpot is considered the soul food of our nation.
The Mongolian nation is famous for its horseback riding skills.
Traditional costumes represent the identity of a nation.
China plays an active role in United Nations peacekeeping missions.
The concept of nation-state emerged after the Treaty of Westphalia.
The national flag of China has five golden stars.
National security is everyone's responsibility.
Peking University is a national key university.
The National Library collects all publications in China.
CCTV broadcasts national news at 7pm daily.
Alipay has become a national payment platform.
The national costume of Tibet is colorful and unique.
Spring Festival is our national cultural heritage.
All stood up when the national anthem was played.
We watched the National Day fireworks over the Bund.
The 1919 May Fourth Movement was fueled by rising nationalism.
Some view football matches as modern expressions of healthy nationalism.
The nationalism of Japanese tea ceremony lies in its precise rituals.
Italian nationalism in cuisine is reflected by their devotion to pasta shapes.
The revival of hanfu reflects contemporary Chinese cultural nationalism.
The nationalist advocated for stronger border controls.
Ancient Chinese nationalists built the Great Wall as a defense system.
During the Olympics, even pacifists can become temporary nationalists.
The Tibetan folk songs stirred nationalist sentiments among the youth.
The debate between ethnic nationalists and multiculturalists never ends.
The nationalistic speech made all citizens stand up and cheer.
Some TikTok trends reflect young people's nationalistic pride.
The World Cup always sparks nationalistic fervor among fans.
Her Chinese nationality allows visa-free access to 80 countries.
Dual nationality is like having two WeChat accounts - convenient but complicated.
The Hui nationality's culinary tradition is a gem of Chinese culture.
Han nationality's Lunar New Year customs include red envelopes and dumplings.
The Olympic medal table ranks by nationality not population.
Baidu's self-driving cars will serve multiple nationalities.
The nationalization of culinary styles created American Chinese food.
Disney's nationalization process turns Mulan into a global icon.
The basketball player's nationalization caused heated debate.
Panda's nationalization documents always go viral.
The nationalization of railways improved punctuality dramatically.
Venezuela's oil nationalization changed global market patterns.
The forced nationalization of private schools raised concerns.
The Brazilian football team nationalized many German-origin players.
Singapore nationalizes foreign talents through special immigration policies.
Venezuela nationalized all oil fields in 2007.
The UK once nationalized its railway system like China's CR.
The treaty nationalized the former colonial territory.
The independence movement aims to nationalize the region.
The government nationalized the education system by adding folk culture courses.
Starbucks nationalized its menu with matcha-flavored drinks in Japan.
Cuba nationalized all American assets in 1960.
The nationalized railways now offer free WiFi for all passengers.
After being nationalized, the oil company started selling mooncake gift boxes.
The nationalized liquor stores have the best baijiu selections.
Even nationalized telecom companies now offer 5G unlimited data plans.
The nationalized bank launched a digital RMB wallet feature.
All nationalized airlines provide free change services during typhoons.
The nationalized industry contributes 30% of China's GDP.

examples.sentence: The costume drama was celebrated nationally as cultural heritage.
Dumplings are recognized nationally as a symbol of family reunion.
People mourned nationally for the earthquake victims.
The vaccine rollout was supported nationally without partisan dispute.
The livestreaming shopping festival trend spread nationally within months.
This dairy brand is distributed nationally through 200,000 convenience stores.
The nationwide delivery network covers even remote villages in Tibet.
A nationwide search for the panda-shaped balloon is happening.
Bubble tea chain plans to go nationwide by 2025.
The Hutong native gave me secret tips for finding the best jianbing.
As a native of Chengdu, she can spot fake spicy hotpot from 10 meters away.
This durian is a native of Southeast Asia, not those knockoffs from other regions.
The tea shop specializes in natives of Fujian province.
Her native Mandarin has a charming Shandong accent.
WeChat Pay is now more popular than cash in its native market.
The panda's native cuteness helps it survive even with poor survival skills.
His native talent for mahjong shocked all his relatives during Spring Festival.
The Great Wall blends perfectly with its native surroundings.
This skincare product uses only native ingredients from the Himalayas.
Peking ducks are native to Beijing, just like their human neighbors.
After 3 months in Sichuan, he went native and started eating chili for breakfast.
The panda's nativity was broadcast live to millions of viewers.
Ancient Greeks believed the nativity hour determined one's fate.
The novel describes the nativity of the protagonist in a typhoon.
Her nativity certificate recorded an unusual double rainbow phenomenon.
The nativity of jazz music can be traced to New Orleans.
We celebrate the nativity of the internet every October 29th.
The museum displays soil samples from the nativity of famous poets.
His accent betrayed his nativity in southern China.
The church choir will perform a nativity play this Christmas.
Nativity scenes often feature shepherds and the Three Wise Men.
Children love rearranging the figurines in the nativity scene.
The uncles kept nattering about rising pork prices during the family reunion.
Don't natter like a broken vending machine when your wifi is slow.
Grannies natter for hours while peeling edamame at teahouses.
My AI speaker natters more than my mother about weather changes.
Taxi drivers natter about everything from UFOs to property prices.
We nattered like magpies about celebrity gossip during the midnight snack.
She nattered on like a TikTok livestream host selling goods.

She gave a natty explanation using emoji metaphors.
The instruction manual had natty illustrations of each step.
The natty squirrel dodged bicycles on campus.
His natty fingers typed 120 words per minute.
As a natty dresser, she matches her mask with outfits.
The new haircut makes you look natty in Zoom meetings.

examples.sentence: Don't be such a naturalâ€”you just microwaved your phone!
That guy's a complete natural, trying to pet a holographic cat.
Her reaction was completely natural when she saw the pandas sneeze.
Using chopsticks feels natural to most Chinese kids by age 3.
Zhangjiajie's natural wonders inspired the floating mountains in Avatar.
The natural pigments in butterfly wings are being studied for solar panels.
A natural reflex makes you blink when something flies at your eyes.
Ducks have a natural ability to swim right after hatching.
Moutai is made from natural fermentation of sorghum.
This skincare brand uses natural ingredients like goji berry extract.
The natural world operates under physical laws.
Alchemy attempted to transform natural elements into gold.
It's natural to feel nervous before a job interview.
A natural reaction to spicy food is sweating.
Some minority groups still maintain natural lifestyles.
Cave paintings reveal natural human artistic impulses.
1,2,3 are natural numbers representing countable objects.
Counting sheep uses natural numbers to fight insomnia.
Pandas' thumb-like bones are a result of natural selection.
The Tangshan earthquake was one of deadliest natural disasters in history.
